uniol.apt.analysis.synthesize

Class SynthesizePN

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.analysis.synthesize.SynthesizePN

  • public class SynthesizePN
extends java.lang.Object
    Synthesize a Petri Net from a transition system.
    Author:
    Uli Schlachter

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SynthesizePN.Builder
      Builder class for creating instances of SynthesizePN.
      static class  SynthesizePN.EventStateSeparationProblems
      Iterable for iterating over all event/state separation problems of a transition system.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateUnseparatedStates

        public static java.util.Set<State> calculateUnseparatedStates(java.util.Set<State> states,
                                                              java.util.Set<Region> regions)
        Calculate the set of states which aren't separated by the given regions.
        Parameters:
        states - The states to separate
        regions - The regions that are used for separation
        Returns:
        All states which have for at least one other state the same marking in all regions.

      • minimizeRegions

        public static void minimizeRegions(RegionUtility utility,
                                   java.util.Set<Region> requiredRegions,
                                   boolean onlyEventSeparation)
        Try to eliminate redundant regions.
        Parameters:
        utility - The region utility on which this function should work.
        requiredRegions - Set of regions to minimize. Redundant regions will be removed.
        onlyEventSeparation - Should state separation be ignored?

      • getSeparatingRegions

        public java.util.Set<Region> getSeparatingRegions()
        Get all separating regions which were calculated
        Returns:
        All separating regions found.

      • wasSuccessfullySeparated

        public boolean wasSuccessfullySeparated()
        Check if the transition system was successfully separated.
        Returns:
        True if the transition was successfully separated.

      • getFailedStateSeparationProblems

        public java.util.Collection<java.util.Set<State>> getFailedStateSeparationProblems()
        Get all the state separation problems which could not be solved.
        Returns:
        A set containing sets of two states which cannot be differentiated by any region.

      • getFailedEventStateSeparationProblems

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<State>> getFailedEventStateSeparationProblems()
        Get all the event/state separation problems which could not be solved.
        Returns:
        A set containing instances of the event/state separation problem.

      • getUtility

        public RegionUtility getUtility()
        Get the RegionUtility instance used for synthesis.
        Returns:
        The region utility.

      • getProperties

        public PNProperties getProperties()
        Get the properties that were requested from synthesis.
        Returns:
        The properties.

      • onlyEventSeparation

        public boolean onlyEventSeparation()
        Was only event/state separation solved or also state separation?
        Returns:
        true if only event/state separation was solved

      • isDistributedImplementation

        public static boolean isDistributedImplementation(RegionUtility utility,
                                                  PNProperties properties,
                                                  PetriNet pn)
        Check if the PetriNet is a distributed implementation
        Parameters:
        utility - The region utility that defines the required distribution
        properties - The properties instance to use; this is needed to handle ON correctly.
        pn - The PetriNet to check
        Returns:
        true if the pn is suitably distributed.

      • isGeneralizedTNet

        public static boolean isGeneralizedTNet(PetriNet pn)
        Check if the PetriNet is a generalized T-Net. In a T-Net, every place has a preset and postset with at most one entry. In a generalized T-Net, arc weights are allowed.
        Parameters:
        pn - The Petri net to check
        Returns:
        true if the pn is a generalized T-Net.

      • isGeneralizedMarkedGraph

        public static boolean isGeneralizedMarkedGraph(PetriNet pn)
        Check if the PetriNet is a generalized marked graph. In a marked graph, every place has a preset and postset with exacly one entry. In a generalized marked graph, arc weights are allowed.
        Parameters:
        pn - The Petri net to check
        Returns:
        true if the pn is a generalized marked graph.

      • synthesizePetriNet

        public PetriNet synthesizePetriNet()
        Synthesize a Petri Net from the separating regions that were calculated.
        Returns:
        The synthesized PetriNet

      • synthesizePetriNet

        public PetriNet synthesizePetriNet(java.util.Set<Region> regions)
        Synthesize a Petri net from the given regions, checking that it is indeed a valid solution.
        Parameters:
        regions - The regions that should be used for synthesis.
        Returns:
        The synthesized PetriNet

      • synthesizePetriNet

        public static PetriNet synthesizePetriNet(RegionUtility utility,
                                          java.util.Set<Region> regions)
        Synthesize a Petri Net from the given regions.
        Parameters:
        utility - An instance of RegionUtility for the requested transition system.
        regions - The regions that should be used for synthesis.
        Returns:
        The synthesized PetriNet
